channel.title: Context Engineering Daily - Tools & Frameworks
channel.description: Latest Tools & Frameworks news in Context Engineering

item.title: Quantum NLP models on Natural Language Inference
item.description: arXiv:2510.15972v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Quantum natural language processing (QNLP) offers a novel approach to semantic modeling by embedding compositional structure directly into quantum circuits. This paper investigates the application of QNLP models to the task of Natural Language Inferen...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, paper, framework, transformer, embedding | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: EvolveR: Self-Evolving LLM Agents through an Experience-Driven Lifecycle
item.description: arXiv:2510.16079v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current Large Language Model (LLM) agents show strong performance in tool use, but lack the crucial capability to systematically learn from their own experiences. While existing frameworks mainly focus on mitigating external knowledge gaps, they fail ...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, framework, LLM, large language model, tool | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Limits of Emergent Reasoning of Large Language Models in Agentic Frameworks for Deterministic Games
item.description: arXiv:2510.15974v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent work reports that Large Reasoning Models (LRMs) undergo a collapse in performance on solving puzzles beyond certain perplexity thresholds. In subsequent discourse, questions have arisen as to whether the nature of the task muddles an evaluation...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> arxiv, analysis, prompt, framework, LLM | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: mcp-context-forge - A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications. Converts REST API endpoints to MCP, composes virtual MCP servers with added security and observability, and converts between protocols (stdio, SSE, Streamable HTTP).
item.description: A Model Context Protocol (MCP) Gateway & Registry. Serves as a central management point for tools, resources, and prompts that can be accessed by MCP-compatible LLM applications.
